name: Bigelow Mountain (West Peak)

trails_config.name: Fire Warden's Trail Loop
trails_config.description: A classic Maine loop. Ascends the steep Fire Warden's Trail to the col between Avery and West Peak, then follows the AT across the ridge. Spectacular views of Flagstaff Lake.
trails_config.parking_info: Stratton Brook Pond Parking, Stratton, ME

current_conditions.ai_summary: One of Maine's premier peaks, Bigelow Mountain (West Peak) rises to 4145 feet. It is known for its rugged terrain and panoramic vistas.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 4145 feet, Bigelow Mountain (West Peak) is a standout peak in Maine. Known for its rugged and challenging terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Fire Warden's Trail Loop**, a **12.3 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **Maine 4000-Footers**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **Bigelow Mountain (Avery Peak)**, which is just 0.7 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.
